nodes.bodyText: Please introduce and use an onResult hook

where should I introduce it? in RateLimiterEventProcessor ?
if so then how should I pass the event to it from a static method? event processors are privet fields in rate limiters implementations

See #1264 (comment)
I'm talking about new public methods in the RateLimiter interface analog to the design of the CircuitBreaker, Bulkhead and Retry.
Methods like onResult or onError are better extensible by new functionality. We don't have to touch every RateLimiter decorator method again, if we want to introduce further functionality in the future.
Please introduce and use an onError hook
Please use Either<Throwable, Object> instead of CallsResult

Yes, I would prefer to use Either for now.
We are working on a 2.0 branch which uses Java 11 and has no Vavr dependency anymore. We will replace Either by our own implementation at many places.  This would be the best time to introduce a simpler API.

nodes.bodyText:
We could add a ResultUtil class.
ResultUtil.isSuccessfulAndReturned(eitherResult, responseWithOverloadIndication.class,  response -> response.isPotentialOverload())

As I said, when we remove Vavr from Resilience4j 2.0, we will have a look at the whole code base and might introduce a CallResult class as you suggested. But then we will use it everywhere and consistently.
In v1.x, we are using Either when a user needs to check if the call was a sucess or failure. In v1.x a new ResultUtil helper class could also be utilized in IntervalBiFunction.
If you don't like it, as an alternative we could introduce:
RateLimiterConfig.drainPermissionsOnResult and RateLimiterConfig.drainPermissionsOnException comparable to RetryConfig.retryOnException and RetryConfig.retryOnResult.
